subject: Management
title: What Happens When You Don't Delegate
description: A 60-second lesson on What Happens When You Don't Delegate.

hook.text: A hospital director collapsed from exhaustion. She had been covering three roles for months.

buildup.text: Burnout, missed deadlines, and resentful teams are symptoms of chronic non-delegation.

discovery.text: Refusing to delegate often comes from fear: fear of failure, of being replaceable, of losing quality.

twist.text: Ironically, hoarding work guarantees the failures you were trying to prevent.

climax.text: The director hired two deputies. Patient care scores improved within weeks.

punchline.text: Not delegating is the real risk.

quiz.question: What often drives a manager's refusal to delegate?
options: Fear of failure or being replaceable
